intro: Pilosella glaucescens subsp. adenocymigeriformis, commonly known as the glaucous pilosella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are small and yellow. It is generally a herbaceous perennial with a compact growth habit.
